item.title: Let's stop copying. Introducing the flati module that flattens in Python
item.description: Chao...â€ #Introduction Sometimes you want to combine, or flatten, a nested (nested) list in Python. If you do a web search, you’ll be able to find information on how to deal with such cases immediately. But isn’t it annoying to copy and paste it one by one? I’m tired. So, in this article, I will introduce the module flati that flattens in Python. Currently it supports Python 2.7 and Python 3.
